revised_title: Fossil Flora of Bovey Tracey: A Study of the Miocene Formation and Climate
tldr: This article examines the fossil flora of Bovey Tracey, focusing on the Miocene formation and the climate of the region. The author identifies various plant species and compares the Bovey flora with other continental floras, concluding that the area had a subtropical climate with species such as cinnamon, laurel, fig-trees, palm, and large ferns.
